Description: Two joining fragments of rim and wall of a pottery bowl; brick red clay Nile silt clay, very micaceous; pinkish slip inside and outside, mostly worn away; incised votive inscription to Aphrodite.
Curator's comments: Inside, modern incised inscription 'CEN', probably relating to the repair of the fragments.
Bibliographic references: Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 683, no. 416)
Schlotzhauer & Villing 2006 / East Greek Pottery from Naukratis: The Current State of Research (p. 64 fig. 40, no. 115)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (IA.29)
